basics.name: Yu Otsubo
basics.label: Fullcycle and Public Cloud Tech Lead
basics.summary:
I'm a Software and Infrastructure developer with over 9+ years, and I've been leading some engineering teams in recent years. 
Expert at AWS by using Server-less architecture.
Also a master of Server-side API and Batch with Python.
Additionally, experienced data science with Python and AWS.
I have lectured at AWS Summit Tokyo 19 with company booth.
I have AWS Certified Solution Architect â€“ Professional.

work.summary:
Developing and operating some location-based services by using on-premise servers.
Also develop integrated monitoring systems such as Zabbix.
highlights: Integrate monitoring and operation system using by Zabbix and Expect

work.summary: I had many experiences such as project management, team building, and handling big data. Our team created the analytics operation system with Splunk and Hadoop(MapR) Used for the company's internal log.

Developing and Operating Web-based Chatbot services by using AWS and Python, Node.js.
The architecture is applied by AWS management services such as ECS with Docker, DynamoDB, Lambda, and S3.
Also, creating CI/CD pipelines using by Drone and automation tests using by Pytest.
highlights: First experience using Python and Node.js

work.summary:
Developing data analysis infrastructure using AWS because of analysis of the Chat-bot's conversations.
The architecture is followed by Data-lake architecture.

Senior engineer and AWS tech Lead of developing Web-based and Native App Chat-bot services by using AWS and Python, Node.js.
The number of Team member is over 8-10, experienced only make architect, developing but also team management, solving difficult issues, and negotiating quite a few stakeholders.
highlights: My first experience of tech lead
The Architecture introduced at the AWS Summit

work.summary: Application engineer of developing Web-based event matching platform by using AWS, Nest.js + React with TypeScript.
highlights: Engaged in the full cycle of planning, requirement definition, development, QA, and operation as a full cycle engineer.
Formulate and execute missions and projects for the Product Infrastructure team as Development Manager.
Engaged in the development of a pseudo-live function for live delivery of pre-recorded videos as a video delivery platform/API infrastructure for external collaboration.

work.summary: As an SRE Engineer, improved continuous development processes using CDK, GitHub Actions, and Autify.
highlights: Joined as SRE engineer to build and improve CI/CD pipeline/infrastructure (AWS).
Migration of services built on EC2 to ECS/Fargate while building Blue/Green deployment mechanism.
Expansion of automated testing using Autify and development of execution pipeline to improve efficiency of QA operations.

work.summary: I develop AI agent applications leveraging generative AI technologies.
highlights: Currently serving as the development lead for "A-BOSS" an AI agent created specifically for sales organizations.

awards.title: Award of technology quality improvement annually
awards.summary: Stable and flexible system design utilizing AWS and successfully responded to large-scale traffic without problems.

interests.name: Photograph
keywords: Take photos in metropolis night view

projects.name: The chat-bot service for customer support(Web)
projects.description:
The chat-bot that solves the problems of customers for telecommunications companies.
This chat-bot service is a hybrid architecture of chat-bots and human operators, labor saving and improved customer satisfaction were achieved at the same time.
And also, adopting Elasticsearch as a FAQ search engine and using it in combination with other AI engines achieves a high response rate.
I was Experienced roles on Primary Developer, Data scientist for making FAQ engine and Scrum master for the team.
highlights: Hybrid arch with chat-bot and human operators
Use Elasticsearch for FAQ search engine
roles: Data scientist for making FAQ engine

projects.name: The chatbot service for customer support(Native Apps)
projects.description:
As a chatbot enhancement project created in FY2018, we have made it possible to respond in the same way not only on web pages but also on customer support apps created on Android and iOS.
Like the previous time, it uses a Docker container and AWS managed services, and is structured to be aware of the microarchitecture.
In this architecture, Node.js is used as a server for Backends For Frontends to communicate with customers using apps using Websocket. It uses Python for Backend.
The architecture was presented at AWS Summit Tokyo 2019.
highlights: Hybrid arch with chatbot and human operators
